node.display_long_description:
WE MAKE FITNESS FUN. With over 100 workout options and regular updates, HOLOFIT makes sure your cardio workouts are interactive, motivating, and fun! 

Run, cycle, or row in 11 amazing worlds, use one of HIIT, Fat burn, or Time-attack programs, compete with other members of the community, and spend up to 400 calories in one session.

What do I need for HOLOFIT? 
- Monthly/ Yearly Membership 
- Optional: Compatible fitness machine. 
Start your 7-day free trial today:  https://www.holodia.com/consumer/ 

Work out in Paris, Antarctica, Babylon, Snowy Mountains, Tropical, Saturn, Aiguebelette, Cambridge, San Francisco, Underwater, and the amazing world of Troglodytes! Measure calorie-burn, save your workout data and progress in our Android/iOS companion app.

Use your bodyweight for rowing, running or cycling exercises, or connect HOLOFIT to your bike, rower, or elliptical to completely transform your workouts. HOLOFIT works on most bikes, rowers, and ellipticals.

nodes.title: Answering Your Most Frequent Questions
nodes.body_text:
Hello everyone! It’s been a little less than one week since we’ve officially launched on the Oculus store, and we’ve been patiently reading all of your feedback. Thank you all!

We’d love to thank our existing members who gave us positive reviews, we appreciate it very much. Thank you for your patience as we worked to get to the store!

Moreover, we’d love to thank newcomers for checking out HOLOFIT and giving constructive feedback, we always use it to improve our development roadmap.

We’ve also seen many questions since launch, so we are addressing those in this short post.

Why a subscription?
Because it’s the only way we can continue to bring monthly upgrades and updates to our community. Something new to motivate you to work out, every single month.

We are not a gaming company, we are a fitness company that uses gaming to push our users’ fitness to new highs. Subscription is a standard in the fitness industry, whether it’s the monthly membership you pay at your gym, your Peloton monthly membership subscription, or the monthly fee you pay for your Apple Fitness+.

It doesn’t work with my rowing machine/ bike/ elliptical.

HOLOFIT connects to fitness machines over Bluetooth and not all machines work with HOLOFIT right out of the box. In some cases, you would need to add a cadence sensor to your elliptical/bicycle to enable a Bluetooth connection. 
Please note that cadence sensors don’t work with rowing machines.

Compatible rowing machines:
- Concept 2 PM5
- WaterRower with SmartRow or ComModule add-on
- StairMaster HIIT rower
- TechnoGym SkillRow
- Domyos 500 rowing machine

Compatible bikes:
- Any bike with the additional cadence sensor
Our recommendation: IGPSport C61 sensor

Compatible elliptical machines:
- Any wheel-based elliptical machine. The cadence sensor has to spin in a circular motion for it to work.

What if I don’t have a fitness machine? 
You can use HOLOFIT Freestyle with Oculus controllers to simulate rowing, running, and cycling using bodyweight exercises.

If your avatar is going too slow, pick up the pace! You really need to be swinging those arms, engaging your core and shoulders to go faster :)

Can I use HOLOFIT Freestyle on my non-listed rowing machine?
Some of our members use HOLOFIT Freestyle on their rowing machines by attaching the Oculus controllers on the rowing handlebar. However, note that your workout data won’t be as precise as when using HOLOFIT with the rowing machine.

We are preparing an update that would enable head tracking for this purpose so that you don’t have to attach the controllers to the handlebar.

The workout data shown in HOLOFIT is not accurate. 
When there is a direct connection between HOLOFIT and your rowing machine, there shouldn’t be any significant discrepancies between that data that your machine reports and the data HOLOFIT reports.

However, if you have noticed a major discrepancy, please email support@holodia.com and let us know.

The Freestyle mode with Oculus controllers is moving really slowly for me. Am I doing something wrong?

Our goal is to make you have a proper workout, and we do this by making you move as much as possible. HOLOFIT Freestyle tracks your hand controllers, and if your avatar is going too slow, pick up the pace!

You really need to be swinging those arms, engaging your core, arms, and shoulders to go faster :) And don’t forget about your legs. Engage your quads and your calves when running or cycling, by squatting and maybe even squat pulsing.

What are the plans for the future? 
We are preparing new worlds, new levels, new Freestyle workouts, new music and new Multiplayer challenges. And much more, but we will keep it as a surprise for now :)

Is hand-tracking coming?
Yes!

What about Google Fit/ Apple Health and other 3rd party fitness app integrations?
This will be a part of one of our next updates, currently under development.

I don’t like the graphics.
We have a specific graphic style, it is an animated, original creation coming from our development team. You might love it (or maybe love it less), and we appreciate all your feedback and comments.

We are constantly working on improving graphics performance and quality, while still keeping our recognizable style.

node.reviewDescription:
I use it since Christmas.
The idea is good for this pandemic time, water rowing is not so boring, here are the goods:
- many mode (time attack, race, multiplayer)
- many levels (cities, nature, underwater, etc)
- bluetooth connection to the fitness machine
- nice music

But be aware:
- No anti aliasing fx (flashing edges, water, etc)
- Simple graphics, low quality textures (eyebuffer size is only 1296 pixels)
- No 90Hz support (yet)
- No object collision detection

Quest2 can do a much better job! For $10/month i think devs should make this a better app in near future. 
For me it would be much better for pay once a higher price, and when a new content is available i can decide if i like to buy that DLC or not. 

Please consider, good luck!
node.reviewTitle: Good idea with low quality graphics
